title: How to see moral universalism in today’s world - Quora

response.answer_text: Non-existent and moral according to who? Morality is a generational human construction based upon geography and culture. For there to a world wide code of moral conduct military policing would be required for enforcement. Would this then be the new universal moralism—totalitarianism? Perhaps there will come a time in humanity’s distant future when there will be a unifying moral code of conduct, but to be just that there must be a single identity for human life that precedes culture and an acceptance of the individual as that sovereign entity.

Universally, I don’t. If I’m understanding the question correctly, due to such vast differences in cultures and religions it’s difficult (if not impossible) to find a standard deviation for a middle ground without a “group” (for a lack of a better word) having to compromise their values and beliefs. Which reinforces my belief, live and let live.
